explanation: The report is not correct. Rule 8.13 encourages using pointers to const when the pointed-to object is logically immutable, but in the provided code the UserEntry objects are not immutable: user_ids is declared as a non-const array (static struct UserEntry user_ids[2]) and the struct contains modifiable members (uint8_t hash arrays and int flags). Moreover find_entry_by_userinfo returns a non-const pointer and forwards that pointer; changing find_entry_by_username to return const struct UserEntry * would force API changes and would prevent legitimate modifications of the mutable fields. If the table truly were intended read-only, the right fix would be to make the table itself const (e.g. static const struct UserEntry user_ids[] ) and then return const struct UserEntry *. Given the current definitions and usage, returning a non-const pointer is appropriate, so there is no MISRA 8.13 violation here.
